ReleaseNotes.Note: Ability to send user suggestions directly to the Jira project management board for Dashboard.

Project Template Wizard was added on the project picking screen.  This wizard takes you through building a typical project by just answering some basic questions.  This method allows the user to specify the basic corpora that they want for a project and it will automatically manage the creation of the project and initial views so that the user doesn’t need to monitor the process.

The Manage Collaboration Projects window now has the ability to delete a project from being shared.  This will clean up files locally and essentially restore your project to being only hosted locally.  Note if there are connected users to your collaboration project, they will also be disconnected from the share and will likewise only have a local copy of the database.

The ability Edit Alignments through the bulk approval process is now available.  This feature is disabled by default and must be turned on from the Settings panel.  This feature allows a user to manually identify, through a concordance view, aligned word pairs.  The user can then approve or deny alignments within this panel.
Added in the ability for users to associate notes with translations/glosses.
Collab upgrade notification is now extended to the Project Picker screen.
Ability to use either Paratext 9.3.x or Paratext Beta platforms.  This extends to the plugin control which will be installed in Paratext Beta if present.
Filter PINS now works in the interlinear verse display from both SOURCE and TARGET words.
Token splitting aka the ability to split a word into sub words
Label Groups
Notes Templates
Lexicon Importing is now available from the corpus node menu.
Many improvements were made to the user interface and to the user experience to help provide consistency as well as improved program flow.
Allow the user to access the Settings Panel from the project picking screen.
Already imported books can now be updated from Paratext.
Send Message to Clear sent message was made more clear and obvious.
Fix - If a user adds multiple New Meanings and Translations, the dialog window could exceed the screen display.
Fix - Expanded View always opened on the wrong screen no matter what display settings were requested in the Settings window.
Fix - Previous project’s view was persisting when a new project template is created.
Fix - Add new Alignment or Interlinear menu items are removed when there are no remaining options available.
Fix - Ensuring that Dashboard does not throw errors when there is no internet.
Fix - Addressed a bug related to if a user had made lexicon changes and then pushed those changes to collaboration.
Fix - Fied the duplicate PINS occurrence in the verse popup
Fix - Addressed an issue when the file path to the collaboration working files on a users machine resulted in a path that exceeded 250 characters long.
Fix - Prevented an instance of PINS crashing because an expected file was not present that didn’t allow the completion of the import.
Fix - For notes that are attached to words that were translated by a user, the Book, Chapter and Verse were not being saved with it.
Fix - In the Text Collection window, a bug was fixed where clicking on a reference sometimes scrolled the selected reference to underneath the reference button bar.
Fix -Fixed a bug with the Collaboration Merge.
Fix - If the user hides the lower PINS panel, the panel did not correctly return to visibility and navigate to the panel.

KnownIssues: For the beta users who had two Dashboard plugin instances in their Paretext menu, the new installer will correct that issue. However, depending on the menu item you previously selected, you may end up with Paratext complaining that the plugin can no longer be found. Just delete that window and then use the menus to open a new instance of the plugin.

There is a Paratext bug for project types outside the normal set. If you try to load up a new Paratext Corpus and the list of projects is blank, this is a good indicator that this bug is affecting you.  Please contact Clear and we can help diagnose which project is the problem project type.

ReleaseNotes.Note: New Testament Pronominal Reference data now available in the Macula Greek corpus
Resource corpora can now be updated to include books that weren’t tokenized initially
Regular users on a shared project can be made owners
New users can now send an email to Clear from the Registration window to ask for a license
Enhanced and streamlined license registration
In the Help menu there is an account info page that shows what the user’s Paratext, ClearDashboard, and Collab usernames are at that moment.
Users are now notified when a project has changes on the server that are not present on their local copy, so they can stay up to date.
Better notifications if when when Import, Commit, or Get Latest succeeded or failed
Better syncing notifications for updating when importing projects
Popup to confirm the users actually does want to delete a project
Pins improvements: loading is faster, the UI has been streamlined, can now filter by Biblical Languages
Users can now switch Paratext projects without having to shut down ClearDashboard or Paratext
Improved Collab Project Management:
Project Design Surface arrows are now thicker and more clickable
Notification of newest version has been changed to “Update to New Version of ClearDashboard”
Signing up for Collab is now necessary to continue to use the app.  Account details are updated every time the app is opened.
Small Timer and Note Delete UI changes
Some Lexicon UI Polish
Other small UI changes
when signing up for Collab all codes sent to you email are treated as valid instead of only the most recent code being valid
Fix - The list of yet to be imported Collab Projects was grayed out when first starting Dashboard
Fix - Adding a new EnhancedView from the MainMenu didn’t work properly
Fix - Clicking on the ClearDashboard Plugin widow in Paratext caused the plugin to disconnect
Fix - After Restarting Paratext, Dashboard wasn’t able to reconnect without restarting the app
Fix - Whether or not a search term was capitalized affected Pins search results
Fix - The bottom of the Verse Reference window in Pins was being cut off in certain screen resolutions
Fix - Missing localizations in the Collab User Creation Window
Fix - Text in the Psalms weren’t the same in ClearDashboard and Paratext because of how we were handling superscriptions
Fix- Handling the case on the ProjectPicker where the server is down
Fix - Solved positioning and cancellation bugs with EnhancedView rename dialog
Fix - Users are now able to get latest changes for collab project with Joined Tokens on the server
Fix - UI now updates Notes replies after merging in from Collab
Project owners can now add others users as owners on a project.
Fix - Sometimes initializing a project with Collab caused an issue.
Fix - Clicking on and then off of the ClearDashboard plugin window in Paratext will no longer close the plugin connection.
Collaboration on projects is going into QA Testing on 6/5/2023.  This includes hosting our own private GitLab server for end user repositories.
Collaboration Manager to automatically add other users to your project, controlled by the repository owner.
Collaboration creation of new user on GitLab server along with email validation.
Verse-by-Verse display option for TextCollections
BackTranslation text has been added to the Verse References dialog of the Pins window and some columns in the Pins tab have been combined.
A link to cleardashboard.org where users can watch instructional videos
Additional end user metrics flushing and delay on exit to avoid missing data push to server.
Aqua endpoint has been updated and now will work again.
Fixes to parallel creation steps that better address USFM errors from Paratext
The Pins panel has many minor UI changes, including displaying a verse’s back translation if available.
Tokens now Copy/Paste in original sentence order
Removal of unused Xceed licensing toolset
Alignment clear selection after join/unjoin operations
Fix - New user licensing bug
Fix - Joining/Unjoining words in the Enhanced view no longer causes token duplication
Fix - Exiting out of dialog during parallelization now removes arrow from Design Surface
Fix - Text Collections bug where Cyrillic text was not being displayed correctly has been resolved by ensuring that end users have the Noto Serif font on their systems.
Fix - Users are now unable to have the same project open in two instances of dashboard at the same time
Fix - Resizing the application window now saves between sessions.
Fix - ClearDashboard no longer freezes when starting it up for the first time after installation.
Fix - Addressed an issue where Licenses weren’t able to decrypt for new users.
Fix - Extra enhanced view tabs are no longer deleted upon closing and reopening the application.
Now not able able to select books in tokenization dialog until USFM has finished being scanned for errors
Fix - The current ClearDashboard project name now appears at the top of the application when a new project is created
Darkened text collection highlight color
Explanatory text for Latin Word Tokenizer option saying that it is the “most common”
Update database button to reset verse mappings to default versification
Deleting either a Project Design Surface node or parallel corpus line will also remove any references from the Enhanced Views
“Create New Interlinear” menu item functionality added off of the right click menu of a connector line.
“Create New Alignment” menu item functionality
Ability to delete individual alignments and interlinears from the Project Design Surface’s right click context menus.
Ability to view a corpus in a database even if the user’s doesn’t have access to that corpus in Paratext
Menu item to Help section of menu to pull up documentation
Right click on a token and filter Pins by Key Terms and use radio buttons to filter Pins by XmlSource in Pins Pane
Notes now updated when a tokenized Text corpus is updated
In an alignment view, unaligned words are colored grey while aligned words are colored black
Fix - Notes on composite tokens can now be passed to Paratext
Fix - Proper Fonts are now displayed in Marble and Lexicon dialog.
Fix - Removed Hebrew chapter tags from USFM to prevent them from appearing as text in a translation

A project now will render all the versification mappings for the entire Bible instead of only those books that were imported.  This is being done to avoid issues later on if the user decides to import additional books that were not included in the first import.  Old databases built under the original format will now display a button on the project picking window that will ask if the user wants to update to the new versification format.  Doing this will rebuild the entire versification mappings throughout the Dashboard process.
A project can now no longer be open in multiple instances of Dashboard at the same time
Resources in the Project Design Surface are now colored as green instead of blue as projects
Dashboard will now show a disconnect and play a sound when the plugin is closed in Paratext.
The default percentage of the lower dock windows has been raised up to better accommodate a larger view.
EnhancedViews can now no longer be deleted while loading
The VC++ runtime no longer installs every time ClearDashboard is installed
The Lower Panes are now taller
Notes Pane UI
Made Text Collections navigation bar sticky and smaller
The verse mapping between two corpora has been completely rewritten to provide for more text coverage and provide for expected performance gains.
Note replies UI
Many small quality of life changes to the world clock
Fix - Solved issue of Update link not appearing for full release
Fix - Solved issue where all corpora were set to original versification
Fix - Solved bug regarding not being able to add a label to a note sometimes
Disabled Aqua on install and added menu item that allows enabling and disabling of aqua
removed new alignment/interlinear menu options
Dashboard_Instructions.pdf
Ability for notes to be associated with composite tokens
A lot more things have been localized
Added IsSymmeterized to AlignmentSet database model
AQuA is now hidden in the settings menu and users must restart the application to enable/disable it
Hmm, IBM4, and non-symmetrized are now alignment options
Fix - right-clicking composite tokens now updates selection after joining/unjoining
Fix - Hebrew Vowels are no longer misplaced
Fix - Setting language in ProjectPicker now persists to MainView
Fix - Opening Dashboard with Paratext on but the Dashboard Plugin off results in the proper text displayed on the Dashboard startup screen
Fix - The tokenization queue now properly reacts when a corpus is deleted or canceled
Fix - Visual and scrolling issues in the General Information part of the Marble tab have been fixed
Fix - The notes indicator did not go away on works if they were not highlighted while the note was being removed
Fix - Adding back a corpus while it was also being deleted caused an error.
Fix - Text is now copyable out of the Background tasks window
Textboxes and buttons in the alignment dialog will be disabled while alignments are running
Notes list tab that allows users to see and search through all their notes in ClearDashboard
Heatmap to AQuA
Experimental alignment triangulation feature
ReleaseNotes window is now faster to load and can scrollable with the mouse wheel
Fix - Resolved issue where changing Dashboard language to simplified Chinese would freeze everything
Fix - Resolved potential issue with deleting incorrect alignments
Fix - Resolved issue with alignment highlighting not appearing
Fix -  Right clicking on a composite token after joining produced an error
Experimental AQUA interfaces have been added. This is very much a work-in-progress experimentation and will be refined as the project progresses.

Experimental alignment editing and deleting functionality has been added to this release. When there is an alignment between a source composite token and a target token in another verse, highlighting the tokens only works if you shift-hover over the target token in the other verse. To create an alignment, click on the source token (composite or regular), then shift-click on the target token. You will need to shift-hover to see the newly added alignment. To delete an alignment, shift hover to find the alignment. You can delete the alignment form either the source or target token.
New dialog for interlinear changes where lexemes can be added to translations.
shortcut to open list of projects with Ctrl + O
added mouse wheel scrolling for elements in the Marble pane
Allow corpora to be deleted when the background status is completed yet still in the background status window
Fix - On the interlinear approval/modification dialog, clicking on the “Apply Translation” button now will work at properly approving the selected word even if no changes have been made.
Fix - Addressed copy issues in Biblical Terms pane
Fix - addressed issues in TextCollections including RTL languages and missing TND content
Fix - Some texts in TextCollections weren’t being highlighted
Notes list with filtering and a way to quickly mark notes ‘resolved’ will be released in a subsequent version.
Notes sharing will be released in a subsequent version.
